content:
I am a graduate student in the Graduate Group of Biostatistics, at University of California, Berkeley, under the supervison of Prof. Yun S. Song. I am broadly interested in statistical machine learning, causal inference and transfer learning, with applications in scRNA-seq and microbiome.
Pronouns: she/her/hers
summary: I am a graduate student in the Graduate Group of Biostatistics, at University of California, Berkeley, under the supervison of Prof. Yun S. Song. I am broadly interested in statistical machine learning, causal inference and transfer learning, with applications in scRNA-seq and microbiome.
title: Yutong Wang

content:
Course Information  Professor: Adam Lucas Office Hours: sign-up sheet. W 12-1pm, Th 1-3pm, F 9:30-10:30am Lab Sections: F 12-2pm, F 4-6pm Content: STAT 135 is Berkeley’s upper-division course on statistical theory and methodology for undergraduates in statistics and related fields. Topics include parameter estimation, hypothesis testing, statistical tests (parametric and non parametric) and linear regression (single and multiple).  The following slides are made by me, so I take responsibility for any typo. The problem sets in the slides are from previous iterations of the class.
Materials  Lab 1: R setup and practice  Part 1: Parametric Estimation
  Lab 2: MoM, nonparametric bootstrap, SE calculation
  Lab 3: MLE, Delta method
  Lab 4: Quiz 1 recap, Fisher information, CRLB, MSE, ggplot
  Lab 5: Sufficiency, minimal sufficiency, Rao-Blackwell theorem
  Part 2: Hypothesis Testing
  Lab 6: Hypothesis testing, Neyman-Pearson lemma, LRT, UMP test, GLRT, p value
  Lab 7: Midterm Review
  Part 3: Statistical Tests (parametric & nonparametric)
  Lab 8: 2-sample t-test, chi-squared test | Recording
  Lab 9: TOH, TOI, Mann-Whitney test | Recording
  Lab 10: Wilcoxon signed rank test, ANOVA, Bonferroni correction | Recording
title: Statistics 135: Concepts of Statistics (Spring 2020)

content: Course Information  Professor: Cari Kaufman Office Hours: W, F 9-11am @ 426 Evans Lab Sections: M, W 12-1pm @285 Cory; M, W 1-2pm @332 Evans Content: STAT 2 is Berkeley’s introductory-level course on statistics for underguates. Topics include descriptive statistics, probability and inference.
title: Statistics 2: Introduction to Statistics (Spring 2019)

content: Course Information  Professor: Cari Kaufman Office Hours: F 11am-3pm @428 Evans Lab Sections: M, W 1-2pm, 4-5pm @334 Evans Content: STAT 2 is Berkeley’s introductory-level course on statistics for underguates. Topics include descriptive statistics, probability and inference.
title: Statistics 2: Introduction to Statistics (Fall 2018)
